column4: Hi, I just tried to download some software from the msdn academie alliance portal (software for students). The problem is the following: to download the software you have to execute an .exe file, however I don't think ubuntu can do this (or at least I have the right application installed). How could I make this work?
it is windows 7 (student edition) - I ll need it in dual boot to work with some of my university's programs :-/
whats the software you need to execute to get the windows 7
check out medibuntu.org also for packages, ie related to playing dvd
it is not really an app. rather an gui for an already 11.04 compatible app (aircrack-ng)
this package is not in the ubuntu repository - but i can give you the sourceforge link
main app package name "aircrack-ng", gui package name "wepcrackgui"
for lucid? a search of the repos shows no such package
as i told you before this package does not form part of any of the ubuntu repository
no idea sorry. you could ask in #aircrack-ng I suppose
will do thank you (btw, that means there is no way to run a compatibility mode in ubuntu whatsoever, right?)
